title: Intro to music theory
content: According to the Oxford English Dictionary music theory is "The study of the theoretical aspects of music and its notation, especially as opposed to actual performance."

There are many examples of successful musicians without formal music training, including Jimi Hendrix, Tom Morello and even The Beatles, though all of these musicians will have some understanding of music theory. Hendrix was notorious for his use and manipulation of the "pentatonic scale" which you will learn about later on.

title: Why is music theory important?
content: A good understanding of music theory can open up a whole new series of possibilities when it comes to writing, can drastically reduce time in terms of writing and can even make music documentation more efficient. For example, having a knowledge of scales rather than working from ear means you know the exact sequence of notes to play and will allow you to implement new scales or modes easily.
Being able to record this in "sheet music" means that your music can be easily understood by other musicians.

title: What will I learn?
content: We have categorised many different topics under varying difficulty levels. It is advised that you progress through the app in the order of the topics presented as you will be tested as various points using a quiz.
